intro: Pedicularis streptorhyncha, commonly known as the spiked beardtongue, is a member of the Orobanchaceae family and is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces striking, spurred flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant has a unique morphology, featuring a slender, erect stem and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are specialized for pollination by bees and other insects, with a long, tubular corolla that facilitates nectar access. Pedicularis streptorhyncha thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
